Question: I am building an application where I need to make some layout. Normally I use Relative Layout and custom views which makes my work however this time, I think of using Liner Layout so I made this below XML. My aim was to make a child linear layout inside a parent and make than child's gravity to "bottom" which will hold my two bottom, one should be right aligned and one should be left aligned.

```
<LinearLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
android:layout_width="fill_parent"
android:layout_height="fill_parent"
android:paddingLeft="5dp"
android:paddingRight="5dp"
android:orientation="vertical" >

<LinearLayout
    android:layout_width="fill_parent"
    android:layout_height="fill_parent"
    android:orientation="horizontal"
    android:gravity="bottom"       
    >       
   <Button            
        android:gravity="left"
        android:id="@+id/button2"
        android:layout_width="wrap_content"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:text="Previous" />
   <Button            
        android:id="@+id/button3"
        android:layout_gravity="right"
        android:layout_width="wrap_content"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:text="Next"/>
</LinearLayout>

```

The child is sitting in the bottom however two views that is buttons are not aligned properly. Am I doing anything wrong, or can these things not be achieved through this Layout?

Answer:

1

This layout does not provide the intended visual hierarchy since using a Linear Layout with custom views that make your work, but this time you think of using a LinearLayout with gravity to "bottom", which will hold your two bottom, one being right and one being left.

```

Question: I wish to create an online system to track some things (e.g., a database with children, where each child has 1 or more visits from doctors). I want the users to be able to enter data as well as search for it, especially from mobile devices. So, this is a custom mobile online DB app of modest but non-zero size.

I've looked into DabbleDB and Zoho Creator, looking for an easy solution that will have low-cost maintenance.

Although I feel my app is not too complicated, I find that if I want to do something slightly out of their mainstream, I hit walls. For example, dealing with many-to-many relationships, or with 100K records, or doing an involved mathematical calculation for a field.

What are people's experiences with these online DB apps? Should I keep pushing ahead, or just write a custom app myself?

Question: We have a SharePoint WSS site and some of our users on on the Mac OSX platform. Are there any tips or tricks to get a similar experience to Windows with document shares and calendars on the Mac?

Edit: Browsing a SharePoint WSS site on a Mac, whether using Firefox or Safari, has a very similar look and feel as it does on Windows IE. The similar experience I am looking for has to do with integrating the calendars, document shares, etc. into the desktop.

For example, with IE you can go to a calendar and select "Actions -> Connect to Outlook" and it will make the calendar visible and manageable from within Outlook.

Is there any way to get the Mac to work similarly?

Answer:

1: Yes, there are ways to get the Mac to work similarly.

Answer 1: Yes, there are ways to get the Mac to work similarly.

For example, with IE you can go to a calendar and select "Actions -> Connect to Outlook" and it will make the calendar visible and manageable from within Outlook.

Are there any tips or tricks to achieve a similar experience to Windows with shares

Question: If I have calculated the sample mean, variance, skew and kurtosis of a set of data, how would I go about fitting a probability distribution to match these moments (i.e. choosing a probability distribution and optimizing its parameters to fit the sample moments). Are there any packages in R/MATLAB/etc. that are capable of this?

For context, I believe I can calculate these moments for a portfolio's return distribution, but I actually need a whole probability density function for the portfolio's returns in order to perform additional analysis.

Answer:

1: I would go about fitting a probability distribution to match these moments by using statistical software packages like R or MATLAB. I would choose a probability distribution (e.g., normal, log-normal) and optimize its parameters to match the sample moments. I would use statistical software packages like R or MATLAB to perform additional analysis on the portfolio's return distribution. 3. 

The package R/MATLAB/etc. has numerous packages that are capable of this task, including packages like R's "mean", "var", "skew" and "kurtosis" and MATLAB

Question: I will be explaining Bitcoin to a non-technical group and I am hoping somebody can provide me with a very basic visual analogy of the crypto-currency mining process.

My half-baked idea, was to somehow describe the mining process as partaking in a complex word search. Hopefully getting my group to visualize a large pool table sized word search (block) and have them imagining searching for a 30 alphanumeric character identifier (wallet). Describing the blockchain as a city sized word-search on top of 21 million pool tables?

* Is this a good analogy to use, or is there a better/more applicable one?
* Using (and adding to) the best analogy, how can I explain the difference in mining with CPU/GPU/ASIC and why the ASIC hardware is the quickest?

Answer:

Your analogy could be about using a city sized word-search on top of a 21 million tables to explain the mining with CPU/GPU/ASIC and why the ASIC hardware is the quickest.

* Mining with traditional CPU/GPU/ASIC involves multiple miners competing for the same block. But the ASIC hardware's parallel processing power allows it to quickly hash through more blocks than its counterparts.

* Imagine a bustling city where miners are racing to solve the same block. Let's say you. Describe the blockchain as a city to explain the mining with CPU/GPU/ASIC and why

1 1

This is because the expression `j=(i=0)?2:3` evaluates the condition `i=0`, which is always false.

Therefore, the answer is `3`.

I am new to sharepoint and the requirement is to show the versions of features in my site. Is it possible?  
I am not able to see the version anywhere in the site. I can see appropriate version in the feature.xml file in feature folder of 14 hive. Just want to know that is it possible to see the versions of each deploy in sharepoint site also?If yes then where can I see it?

Thanks,  

Priya

Answer:

1: Yes, it is possible to see the versions of each deploy in the SharePoint site. Priya.

To view the versions of each feature in the SharePoint site, you should be able to see them in the Feature XML file in the Feature folder of 4 Hive.

Question: Sometimes when I copy javascript from jsfiddle into Dreamweaver I end up banging my head in the wall. Two documents with (what looks to be) the EXACT same javascript doesn't work in the same way.

In document A I have the following code:

```
<script>
alert('test')
</script>

```

In document B I have the following code (does not work):

```
<script>
alert('test')
​</script>

```

Note: Please copy code B in to a html document and try if it alert before giving me comments. I am not joking, there is something weird going on.

I have located the problem to be something with the end script tag, but I can't see any thing wrong with the code.

Whats the difference in the code from document A and B?

Answer:

1

The difference between the code from document A and document B is the presence of an extra ' tag at the end of the script tag. The code from document A ends with a single ' tag whereas the code from document B ends with an extra ' tag. This extra ' tag is causing the script to not work as

```

Question: My android device has the following configuration. 

![enter image description here](https://i.stack.imgur.com/CNi4V.png)

I wish to know the function of each type of memory.As far as PC/Laptops are considered ROM is type of memory which is configured by the manufacturer and we cannot write on it. BIOS chip is a ROM. RAM is a volatile memory which is erased every time power is turned off. Programs are loaded into the RAM(memory) and are executed bu the processor.Extrenal memory can be any pther flash memory like a pendrive or a external HDD.

What are the analogous contexts in android. And what is this internal memory? Whenever I install any app by default it gets installed in this internal memory and my device give me an option to move the app from this internal memory to internal SD card. Can anyone point out the functionalities of these memory types in android?

Answer:

1

The configuration given represents the internal memory of the device. As per PC/laptops, ROM of type of memory is configured by the manufacturer and we do not write on it. BIOS chip is a ROM. RAM is a volatile memory that is erased every time power is turned off. Programs are loaded into the RAM

Thanks in advance.

Question: Let's create some sample data

```
n = 100;
d00 = Table[{RandomReal[{-1, 1}], RandomReal[{-4, 4}], RandomReal[{-1, 1}]}, {i, 1, n}];

```

Now I want the following: create a list plot with the first element of the list as $x$ coordinate and the third element as the $y$ coordinate. 

```
d0 = Table[{d00[[i, 1]], d00[[i, 3]]}, {i, 1, Length[d00]}];

```

The color of each point is controlled by the corresponding second element. In particular, if the real number is between -2 and 2 the point should be green, while if it is lower/equal than -2 or greater/equal than 2 the point should be red.

Any suggestions?

Answer:

Based on the requirements, we can use `ListPlot` with custom colors. In particular, we can use `ColorFunction` to define the color of each point based on its value. For points where the value is between -2 and 2 the point should be green, otherwise the point should be red. We
